free_text.Learning outcomes: [li] To provide a comprehensive overview of present days techniques and methods to realize micro- and nanodevices for liquid handling.[br/][li] To provide background knowledge on fluid-mechanics and scaling effects.[br/][li] To give an overview of methods for fluid manipulation.[br/][li] To give an overview of sensing and analytical techniques used for Lab-on-a-Chip applications.[br/][li] To discuss the potentials of microreactors and coupling to mass spectrometer (MS) analysis.[br/][li] To provide information about systems for biochemical analysis and bioassays.[br/][li] To give a future outlook in the direction of nanofluidics.
free_text.Content: [li]Introduction to fluid mechanics - modeling/simulation - scaling laws[br/][li]Introduction in microtechnology for fabrication of  microfluidic devices- silicon/glass/polymer techologies-patterning/etching/bonding/deposition techniques[br/][li]Mechanical microfluidic componentsvalves - pumps - flow sensors - mixers/filters - channels - nozzles[br/][li]Non-mechanical microfluidics EOF - MHD - EHD - dielectrophoresis - acoustic actuation - T-sensor- hydrophobic patches - capillary based devices[br/][li]Labs-on-Chip (LOC) / Micro Total Analysis Systems (TAS)[br/][li]Arrays vs. flow systems (microfluidics) - surface vs. beads based systems[br/][li]MS-interfacing: MALDI-TOF/ESI[br/][li]Applications: genomics/proteomics/cell-based systems[br/][li]Nanotechnology/nanofluidics/single molecule analysis
free_text.Keywords: Microreactors, biochemical analysis, microfluidic devices, Labs-on-Chip, Micro Total Analysis Systems
